intro: Psychotria rupicola var. brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved psychotria, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many plants with medicinal and ornamental value. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with slender, often hairy stems and small, elliptical leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, with five petals and a distinctive calyx. This variety is noted for its compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental appeal in shaded garden settings.
